content:
Binika

Binika (also known as Binka) is a town and a Notified Area Council(NAC) in Subarnapur District  in the state of Odisha, India.

Geography
Binka is located at 21°02′N 83°48′E﻿ / ﻿21.03°N 83.8°E﻿ / 21.03; 83.8.[1] It has an average elevation of 122 metres (400 feet).
The city is situated on the bank of river Mahanadi. It is 32 km away from Sonepur district.

Demographics
As of 2001[update] India census,{"citetype": "web", "url": "http://www.censusindia.net/results/town.php?stad=A&state5=999", "title": "Census of India 2001: Data from the 2001 Census, including cities, villages and towns  (Provisional)", "accessdate": "2008-11-01", "archiveurl": "https://web.archive.org/web/20040616075334/http://www.censusindia.net/results/town.php?stad=A&state5=999", "archivedate": "2004-06-16"} Binika had a population of 14,537. Males constitute 51% of the population and females 49%. Binika has an average literacy rate of 63%, higher than the national average of 59.5%; with male literacy of 75% and female literacy of 50%. 13% of the population is under 6 years of age.

Culture and tradition
Papakshya Lokmahotsav, the annual cultural manifestation of Binka (Binitpur) was named on the holy place PAPAKSHYA GHAT. The festival showcases the rich art and culture of our region.

Politics
MLAs who represented Binka Assembly Constituency are Padmanav Behera of BJD (2009-2014 and 2014-2019), Niranjan Pujari of BJD, who won the seat in State elections of 2004 and also in 2000. Previous MLAs from this seat include Narasingha Mishra of JD who won this seat in 1995, Chitiaranjan Mishra of INC in 1985, Pradip Hota of INC(I) in 1980, and independent candidate Parakhita Karna in 1977and other Members from Binka for this constituency are Panchanan Mishra 1990, Radhamohan Mishra, Nrusimha Charan Mishra, Baikuntha Nepak, Anantaram Nanda{"citetype": "web", "url ": "http://archive.eci.gov.in/March2004/pollupd/ac/states/s18/Partycomp113.htm", "title ": "State Elections 2004 - Partywise Comparison for 113-Binka Constituency of Odisha", "publisher ": "Election Commission of India"}
Binka is part of Bolangir (Lok Sabha constituency).{"citetype": "web", "url": "http://archive.eci.gov.in/se2000/background/S18/Orissa_AC_Dist_PC.pdf", "title": "Assembly Constituencies - Corresponding Districts and Parliamentary Constituencies of Odisha", "publisher": "Election Commission of India", "accessdate": "2008-09-26", "urlstatus": "dead", "archiveurl": "https://web.archive.org/web/20090304184320/http://archive.eci.gov.in/se2000/background/S18/Orissa_AC_Dist_PC.pdf"}

Transport
Road Transport
Binka is a major marketing hub of Subarnapur District and is well-connected by roads to all other districts and major cities of Odisha and India.
The town has a good network of roads for commercial as well as public transportation. SH 55 is the major State Highway in or through Binka.
Nearest Railway Station(s)
The Nearest Railway Station from Binka is Barpali Railway Station which is 32 kms from Binka by Road.
Nearest Airport(s)
The nearest airports are Veer Surendra Sai Airport, Jharsuguda (126 km, 78 mi) and Swami Vivekananda Airport, Raipur (253 km, 157 mi) and Biju Patnaik International Airport, Bhubaneswar (291 km, 181 mi).
